member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator
member.summary: is used to ensure that an obtained using OpenIdConnect is compliant with http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html .

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.DefaultNonceLifetime
member.summary: Default for the how long the nonce is valid.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of ,

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.GenerateNonce
member.summary: Generates a value suitable to use as a nonce.
member.remarks:
if is true then the 'nonce' will contain the Epoch time as the prefix, seperated by a '.'.
for example: 635410359229176103.MjQxMzU0ODUtMTdiNi00NzAwLWE4MjYtNTE4NGExYmMxNTNlZmRkOGU4NjctZjQ5OS00MWIyLTljNTEtMjg3NmM0NzI4ZTc5

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.HashAlgorithmMap
member.summary: Gets the algorithm mapping between OpenIdConnect and .Net for Hash algorithms. a that contains mappings from the JWT namespace http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7518 to .Net.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.NonceLifetime
member.summary: Gets or set the defining how long a nonce is valid.
member.exception: If 'value' is less than or equal to 'TimeSpan.Zero'.
member.remarks: If is true, then the nonce timestamp is bound by DateTime.UtcNow + NonceLifetime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.RequireAcr
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if an 'acr' claim is required.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if an 'amr' claim is required.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if an 'azp' claim is required.

member.summary: Get or sets if a nonce is required.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.ValidateAuthenticationResponse(Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates that an OpenIdConnect Response from 'authorization_endpoint" is valid as per http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html
member.param: the that contains expected values.
member.exception: If 'validationContext' is null.
If the response is not spec compliant.
member.remarks: It is assumed that the IdToken had ('aud', 'iss', 'signature', 'lifetime') validated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.ValidateTokenResponse(Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates that an OpenIdConnect Response from "token_endpoint" is valid as per http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html
member.param: the that contains expected values.
member.exception: If 'validationContext' is null.
If the response is not spec compliant.
member.remarks: It is assumed that the IdToken had ('aud', 'iss', 'signature', 'lifetime') validated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.ValidateUserInfoResponse(Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates that an OpenIdConnect Response from "useinfo_endpoint" is valid as per http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html
member.param: the that contains expected values.
member.exception: If 'validationContext' is null.
If the response is not spec compliant.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.ValidateIdToken(Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the claims in the 'id_token' as per http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#IDTokenValidation
member.param: the that contains expected values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.GetHashAlgorithm(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a corresponding to string 'algorithm' after translation using .
member.param: string representing the hash algorithm

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.CryptoProviderFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets the that will be used for crypto operations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.ValidateHash(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validates the 'token' or 'code' see: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html
member.param: The expected value of the hash. normally the c_hash or at_hash claim.
Item to be hashed per oidc spec.
Algorithm for computing hash over hashItem.
member.exception: If expected value does not equal the hashed value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.ValidateCHash(Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the 'code' according to http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html
member.param: A that contains the protocol message to validate.
member.exception: If 'validationContext' is null.
If 'validationContext.ValidatedIdToken' is null.
If the validationContext contains a 'code' and there is no 'c_hash' claim in the 'id_token'.
If the validationContext contains a 'code' and the 'c_hash' claim is not a string in the 'id_token'.
If the 'c_hash' claim in the 'id_token' does not correspond to the 'code' in the response.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.ValidateAtHash(Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the 'token' according to http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html
member.param: A that contains the protocol message to validate.
member.exception: If 'validationContext' is null.
If 'validationContext.ValidatedIdToken' is null.
If the validationContext contains a 'token' and there is no 'at_hash' claim in the id_token.
If the validationContext contains a 'token' and the 'at_hash' claim is not a string in the 'id_token'.
If the 'at_hash' claim in the 'id_token' does not correspond to the 'access_token' in the response.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.ValidateNonce(Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates that the contains the nonce.
member.param: A that contains the 'nonce' to validate.
member.exception: If 'validationContext' is null.
If 'validationContext.ValidatedIdToken' is null.
If is null and RequireNonce is true.
If the 'nonce' found in the 'id_token' does not match .
If is true and a timestamp is not: found, well formed, negatire or expired.
member.remarks:
The timestamp is only validated if is true.
If is not-null, then a matching 'nonce' must exist in the 'id_token'.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.ValidateState(Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates that the 'state' in message is valid.
member.param: A that contains the 'state' to validate.
member.exception: If 'validationContext' is null.
If 'validationContext.ProtocolMessage ' is null.
If 'validationContext.State' is present in but either or its state property is null.
If 'state' in the context does not match the state in the message.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectRequestType
member.summary: RequestTypes for OpenIdConnect.
member.remarks: Can be used to determine the message type by consumers of an . For example: sets to .

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectRequestType.Authentication
member.summary: Indicates an Authentication Request see: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#AuthRequest.

member.summary: Indicates a Logout Request see:http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-frontchannel-1_0.html#RPLogout.

member.summary: Indicates a Token Request see: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#TokenRequest.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectResponseMode

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectResponseMode.Query

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectResponseMode.Fragment
member.summary: Indicates a Fragment Response see: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#ImplicitAuthResponse.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectResponseType
member.summary: Response types for OpenIdConnect.
member.remarks: Can be used to determine the message type by consumers of an . For example: OpenIdConnectMessageTests.Publics() sets to .

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectResponseType.Code
member.summary: Indicates 'code' type see: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#CodeFlowAuth. For Example: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#codeExample.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectResponseType.CodeIdToken
member.summary: Indicates 'code id_token' type see: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#HybridAuthRequest. For Example: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#code-id_tokenExample.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectResponseType.CodeIdTokenToken
member.summary: Indicates 'code id_token token' type see: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#HybridAuthRequest. For Example: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#code-id_token-tokenExample.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectResponseType.CodeToken
member.summary: Indicates 'code token' type see: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#HybridAuthRequest. For Example: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#code-tokenExample.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectResponseType.IdToken
member.summary: Indicates 'id_token' type see: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#HybridAuthRequest. For Example: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#id_tokenExample.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectResponseType.IdTokenToken
member.summary: Indicates 'id_token token' type see: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#ImplicitFlowAuth. For Example: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#id_token-tokenExample.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectResponseType.None
member.summary: Defined in OAuth v2 multiple response types 1.0 spec, included for completion. See: http://openid.net/specs/oauth-v2-multiple-response-types-1_0.html#OAuthResponseTypesReg.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectResponseType.Token
member.summary: Defined in OAuth 2.0 spec, included for completion. See: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-11.3.2.
